title: the Iron Vanguard
intro: When the Primordial Dragon fell, its soul was shattered into six fragments of avatars that would later be referred to as the Dragon Knights, or the Draconis siblings. Terros is the second sibling, wielding the elemental power of earth and metal. He spends most of his time at the bastion, which he built all on his own over decades. He believes his primary duty of the siblings is not only to rule their people with an iron fist, but also to protect them with an iron wall.

abilities.name: Iron Armour
abilities.details:
Terros builds up layers of iron on his armour when not in combat, granting bonus physical resistance (scaling with physical resistance) each layer (maximum 5 layers).

Each time Terros takes physical damage, a layer will be destroyed and Terros will gain increased movement speed for a short duration. The movement speed boost can be stacked.

abilities.name: Colossal Smash
abilities.details:
Terros winds up his hammer and then smashes the ground, dealing physical damage (scaling with physical resistance) in a target direction and briefly slowing all enemies hit.

In addition, 1 Iron Pillar will rise up at the end of the skill range, obstructing all units' movement.

Using this ability reduce Terros's physical resistance until the Iron Pillars shatter (each Iron Pillar reduces Terros's physical resistance separately.). The Iron Pillars will shatter after a few seconds or when interacted with Terros's other abilities.

Each of the Iron Pillars has 3 bars of health points. There will only be a maximum of 3 Iron Pillars on the ground.

In Earth Dragon form, Colossal Smash becomes a cone-shaped area instead, and 3 Iron Pillars will be created instead of one.

abilities.name: Ferric Storm
abilities.details:
Terros creates floating iron shards around himself, dealing physical damage (scaling with physical resistance) to nearby enemies and reducing their attack speed.

Terros can recast this ability to recall the shards back to his armour, granting himself a shield (scaling with physical resistance).

If one or more Iron Pillars are present, Terros will shatter them during the recast to immediately recover his physical resistance stats and gains an even stronger shield based on the number of Iron Pillars shattered.

In Earth Dragon form, Ferric Storm also reduces nearby enemies' physical resistance.

abilities.name: Heavy Slam
abilities.details:
Terros charges at a target direction, dealing physical damage (scaling with physical resistance) to the first enemy hero hit and pushing the target back along the way.

If the target is slammed into the Iron Pillars, it will shatter the pillars, taking physical damage (scaling with physical resistance) and getting stunned for a short duration.

Slamming the enemy into a terrain will stop the charge, deal less damage and they will be slowed instead of stunned.

In Earth Dragon form, Heavy Slam can push multiple enemies at once.

abilities.name: Earth Breaker
abilities.details:
Terros channels his power to unleash his dragon form. When unleashed, Terros becomes the powerful Earth Dragon, gaining increased physical resistance, size and attack range, while sending out a wave of rupture that deals physical damage (scaling with physical resistance) and knocks up enemies upon contact.

When the wave of rupture touches the Iron Pillars, it will shatter them, dealing physical damage (scaling with physical resistance) to surrouding enemies and briefly stunning them.

If the enemies have already been knocked up, the stun effect takes place after the target lands. If the enemies stand behind the Iron Pillars, they will not be knocked up because the rupture wave would have stopped at the pillars. However, they can still be stunned when the Iron Pillars shatter if they stand too close.

While in Earth Dragon form, his abilities are enhanced.
